name: awareness
description: denotes messages simply mentioning concerns on the effect of decisions on cost, without necessarily implying any action taken.

name: increase
description: denotes messages indicating increase in cost due to a change.

name: save
description: denotes mentioned changes explicitly made to save costs.

name: change
description: denotes messages indicating (semi-)permanent changes that affect costs.

name: test
description: denotes messages indicating temporary changes for the purpose of testing their effect on costs.

name: track
description: denotes messages indicating the use of cost-tracking features as offered (e.g. by service providers).

name: alert
description: denotes messages related to billing alarms (e.g. enforcing an upper threshold on costs).

name: area
description: denotes messages related to the geographical location of one or more resources (e.g. server or instance).

name: billing_mode
description: denotes messages related to the type of billing plan being used (e.g. on-demand for development or reserved plan for production).

name: cluster
description: denotes messages related to cluster configuration (e.g. for managed Kubernetes clusters).

name: cpu
description: denotes messages explicitly related to CPU configurations.

name: domain
description: denotes messages related to domain name system and IP addresses.

name: feature
description: denotes messages related to the incurred costs generated by various application features such as application logs, load balancers or usage of third party libraries or solutions.

name: instance
description: denotes messages related to computational instances (e.g. Amazon AWS t2.micro) used in the deployment.

name: logging
description: denotes messages related to the lifecycle of cost-tracking logging on the provider side.

name: nat
description: denotes messages explicitly related to NAT configurations.

name: networking
description: denotes messages related to networking configuration.

name: policy
description: denotes messages related to the implementation of organizational rules and processes, both automated and manual, to prevent excessive costs.

name: provider
description: denotes messages related to choosing a specific service provider (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform)

name: ram
description: denotes messages explicitly related to RAM configurations.

name: report
description: denotes messages related to the use of cost reports for one or more cloud services.

name: service
description: denotes messages related to the adoption of specific cloud services (e.g. AWS Lambda, AWS EC2, AWS CloudWatch).

name: storage
description: denotes messages related to specific storage solutions and their types (e.g. AWS S3 Glacier) used in the deployment.

name: vpn
description: denotes messages explicitly related to VPN configurations.
